DataElement.preferredName: Gel Medication Skin Irritation Severity Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the degree of pain caused by a dermal tissue reaction from the gel treatment  drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A semisolid system consisting of either suspensions made up of small inorganic particles or large organic molecules interpenetrated by a liquid._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._A mild inflammatory dermal tissue reaction; it can be caused by physical contact with an irritant or can be a local response to a systemic trigger._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A semisolid system consisting of either suspensions made up of small inorganic particles or large organic molecules interpenetrated by a liquid.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Concepts.definition: A semi-solid composed of a solid, three dimensional, cross linked matrix of polymers within a liquid, yielding a jelly-like material unable to flow at steady state.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: A mild inflammatory dermal tissue reaction; it can be caused by physical contact with an irritant or can be a local response to a systemic trigger.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.definition: A mild inflammatory dermal tissue reaction; it can be caused by physical contact with an irritant or can be a local response to a systemic trigger.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
